events.originalText: Japanese figure skater Yuzuru Hanyu won the Four Continents Championships to become the only man to complete a Super Slam.
events.subtitle: Figure skating
events.headline: Yuzuru Hanyu Wins Four Continents Championships

events.originalText: Two commuter trains collided head-on at Bad Aibling in southeastern Germany, killing 12 people and injuring 85.
events.subtitle: Bad Aibling rail accident
events.headline: 12 Killed in Bad Aibling Train Collision

events.originalText: The American submarine USS Greeneville collided with the Ehime Maru, a Japanese training vessel operated by a high school, sinking the latter ship and killing nine people on board.
events.subtitle: USS Greeneville
events.headline: USS Greeneville Collides with Japanese Training Vessel, 9 Dead

events.originalText: Breaking a seventeen-month ceasefire, the Provisional Irish Republican Army detonated a powerful truck bomb in the London Docklands, killing two people and injuring more than a hundred others.
events.subtitle: Provisional Irish Republican Army
events.headline: IRA Truck Bomb in London Docklands Kills 2

events.originalText: Researchers at the GSI Helmholtz Centre for Heavy Ion Research in Darmstadt, Germany, first created the chemical element copernicium.
events.subtitle: GSI Helmholtz Centre for Heavy Ion Research
events.headline: Copernicium Created by Researchers in Germany

events.originalText: The Australian Defence Force was formed by the integration of the Australian Army, the Royal Australian Navy, and the Royal Australian Air Force.
events.subtitle: Australian Defence Force
events.headline: Australian Defence Force Formed by Integration of Military Branches

events.originalText: An earthquake registering 6.6 Mw struck the northern San Fernando Valley near the Los Angeles district of Sylmar, killing 65 people.
events.subtitle: 1971 San Fernando earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake in Sylmar Kills 65 People

events.originalText: As Beatlemania swept the United States, the Beatles (pictured) made their first appearance on The Ed Sullivan Show before a record-breaking audience, beginning a musical phenomenon known as the British Invasion.
events.subtitle: Beatlemania
events.headline: Beatles Make Debut on The Ed Sullivan Show

events.originalText: U.S. senator Joseph McCarthy accused 205 employees of the State Department of being communists, sparking a period of strong anti-communist sentiment known as McCarthyism.
events.subtitle: Joseph McCarthy
events.headline: McCarthy Accuses State Department Employees of Communism

events.originalText: World War II: Allied aircraft unsuccessfully attacked a German destroyer in Førde Fjord, Norway.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Allied Forces Declare Guadalcanal Secure in WWII

events.originalText: World War II: Allied forces declared Guadalcanal secure, ending the Guadalcanal campaign as a significant strategic victory for Allied forces fighting Japan in the Pacific War.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Imperial Japanese Army Begins Battle of Kranji

events.originalText: The Imperial Japanese Army began the Battle of Kranji as part of their campaign to capture Singapore.
events.subtitle: Imperial Japanese Army
events.headline: Stanley Bruce Becomes Prime Minister of Australia

events.originalText: Stanley Bruce became prime minister of Australia as leader of the country's first Coalition government.
events.subtitle: Stanley Bruce
events.headline: Svalbard Treaty Signed, Recognizing Norwegian Sovereignty

events.originalText: The Svalbard Treaty was signed in Paris, recognizing Norwegian sovereignty over the Arctic archipelago of Svalbard.
events.subtitle: Svalbard Treaty
events.headline: Meteor Procession Observed from Canada to Brazil

events.originalText: A meteor procession was observed along a great circle arc from Canada to Brazil, leading astronomers to conclude that its source was a small, short-lived natural satellite of the Earth.
events.subtitle: Meteor procession
events.headline: Mud March in London Organized by Women's Suffrage Societies

events.originalText: More than 3,000 women in London participated in the Mud March (pictured), the first large procession organised by the National Union of Women's Suffrage Societies.
events.subtitle: Mud March (suffragists)
events.headline: Jefferson Davis Named Provisional President of Confederate States

events.originalText: American Civil War: Jefferson Davis was named the provisional president of the Confederate States of America.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Mysterious Hoof-like Marks Found in Devon, England

events.originalText: A series of hoof-like marks in the snow continuing through the countryside for some 40 to 100 miles (60 to 160 km) were discovered in Devon, England.
events.subtitle: Devil's Footprints
events.headline: John Quincy Adams Chosen as President by House of Representatives

events.originalText: After no candidate received a majority of electoral votes in the previous year's presidential election, the United States House of Representatives chose John Quincy Adams as president in a contingent election.
events.subtitle: United States Electoral College
events.headline: USS Constellation Captures French Frigate Insurgente

events.originalText: Quasi-War: USS Constellation captured the French frigate Insurgente in a single-ship action in the Caribbean Sea.
events.subtitle: Quasi-War
events.headline: Mongol Empire Captures Caizhou, Ending Jurchen Rule

events.originalText: Caizhou, the capital of the Jin dynasty, was captured by the Mongol Empire and their Song allies, bringing an end to Jurchen rule.
events.subtitle: Jin dynasty (1115–1234)
